intro: Eupteron acuminatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Eupteron acuminatum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
